thread.title: Michelle Keegan discusses new Our Girl series... and jetting off without hubby Mark Wright
thread.title_full: Michelle Keegan discusses new Our Girl series... and jetting off without hubby Mark Wright - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Michelle Keegan discusses new Our Girl series... and jetting off without hubby Mark Wright
text:
Michelle Keegan discusses new Our Girl series... and jetting off without hubby Mark Wright The star will be jetting out to South Africa for eight months to film the BBC drama Share Comments By Nicola Agius 17:12, 20 FEB 2017 Updated 17:13, 20 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Are these guys the best looking couple in Britain? Share this video Watch Next celebs updates Michelle Keegan is just as excited as Our Girl fans to start working on the next series.
The 29-year-old actress will soon be jetting out to South Africa to spend around eight months filming the third series of popular army drama, while hubby Mark Wright stays at their home in Essex.
However, she doesn't sound too worried about missing him.
Speaking to HELLO! magazine, she said said: "I'll be filming 'Our Girl' [soon], which is so exciting. But no holidays planned yet."
Michelle Keegan is just as excited as Our Girl fans to start working on the next series (Photo: BBC) Michelle only recently returned home following a four-day trip to Los Angeles to shoot the promo for her new spring/summer Lipsy collection.
Read More Michelle Keegan and husband Mark Wright keep it in the family as they enjoy double date night Although she and her other half were on different continents, the actress admitted she had a great time nonetheless as she took time out from photoshoots to do some tourist sightseeing - including visiting Rodeo Drive, where she bought a pair of Gucci shoes, and sipping a Pretty Woman cocktail at the Beverly Wiltshire hotel where iconic scenes from the Julia Robert's rom com 'Pretty Woman' was filmed.
The star loves the Hollywood way of life (Photo: Rex Features) "There's just something in the air out here, you literally feel like you're in a movie," she added. "It's one of my favourite places. I felt like I was stepping right back into old-school Hollywood glamour."
For months, rumours have been swirling that Michelle is planning to leave her home in Essex to crack America and break into the film industry.
And by the sounds of things, she won't have any problems with adjusting to the Hollywood lifestyle.
Michelle and Mark Wright will celebrate their second wedding anniversary in May (Photo: Daily Mirror) "it's very positive [out there]," she continued. "Everyone seems very happy and it's a healthy lifestyle. I that must have something to do with the weather, too. A lot of girls don't wear make-up and they all have beautiful glowing skin because of all the sunshine."
Meanwhile Essex-born Mark is no stranger to working in Los Angeles - he was "over the moon" when the kids' show he co-hosts, 'The Dengineers' was picked up by a US TV network and prior to that he made his transatlantic TV debut in December in two episodes Elizabeth Hurley drama 'The Royals'.
The pair are due to celebrate their second wedding anniversary in May.
